title: I.Sicily inscription 001060
support: Block of the local limestone, originally in situ above the entrance to the rock-cut structure of the gymnasium, but then cut from the site and removed. The epigraphic field is 212 x 64 cm. The face has two large round holes cut into the second line, and a further element cut out of the end of the first line (upper right corner). The lower edge is damaged, obscuring part of line 4.

handNote.lettering: Very regular neat v-cut letters. The text is centred on the stone. Note the use of horizontal lines/dashes between the name and patronym of the officials. Sigma is four bar and open; Pi has short second vertical; omicron and omega are small, the latter closed.

date._: Probably Hieronian in date, given the letter forms and the content.

provenanceFound._: Found in situ, first observed in 1558.

provenanceObserved._: Photographed in the museum by Prag, 2023.

museum.name: Museo Civico di Noto
museum.description: The museum was damaged in an earthquake and all the ancient archaeological material was sent to the Paolo Orsi for safe keeping. They have not yet been returned and the collection currently consists of stones from various medieval buildings, some medieval armour and weaponry, and 2 ancient inscribed blocks
